title: Design Thinking-Based Information Technology Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and experience using digital tools
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment combining face-to-face workshops and online collaboration platforms. Focuses on enhancing learners' creative problem-solving skills and technical application capabilities.

learning_goals: Learners can understand and explain fundamental information technology concepts (algorithms, data structures, etc.).
Learners can use the design thinking stages (empathize-define-ideate-prototype-test) to conduct real-world problem-solving projects.

Learners plan one digital work (app prototype or data visualization) using at least one collaboration tool (Figma, Miro, Canva), collaborate with two team members to complete a three-stage plan (requirements analysis document, wireframe, final prototype), achieve "excellent" in at least four of five peer evaluation rubric items, and complete the process within four weeks.
Learners establish five evaluation criteria for creative outputs (design projects, video content) and write feedback meeting at least three of four rubric criteria during self/peer assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
